description: From Middle English ashamed, aschamed, from Old English āsċeamod, past participle of Old English āsċeamian (“to be ashamed”), equivalent to a- +‎ shame +‎ -ed.

adjectives.description: ashamed (comparative more ashamed, superlative most ashamed)

examples: Be ashamed to die until you have won some victory for humanity.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of ashame
